abstract: Jean-Claude Trichet called on Parliament to stiffen the new regulations, which make penalties for exceeding spending limits more automatic.
snippet: Jean-Claude Trichet called on Parliament to stiffen the new regulations, which make penalties for exceeding spending limits more automatic.
lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — European Union finance ministers agreed on Tuesday to toughen the fiscal rules for euro zone governments, only to have the proposals dismissed as “insufficient” by the president of the European Central Bank, Jean-Claude Trichet.

headline.main: Ink Barely Dry on Finance Ministers’ Deal, Trichet Calls Europe’s New Fiscal Rules Weak
headline.print_headline: Ink Barely Dry on Finance Ministers’ Deal, Trichet Calls Europe’s New Fiscal Rules Weak
